<p>In my case I had two One-to-Many relationship. Two classes of the relationship were in different modules. This caused error. When I put them in the same module it worked. This is the related part from the source: </p>

<pre><code>    public &lt;E extends RealmModel&gt; E copyOrUpdate(Realm realm, E obj, boolean update, Map&lt;RealmModel, RealmObjectProxy&gt; cache) {
    // This cast is correct because obj is either
    // generated by RealmProxy or the original type extending directly from RealmObject
    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") Class&lt;E&gt; clazz = (Class&lt;E&gt;) ((obj instanceof RealmObjectProxy) ? obj.getClass().getSuperclass() : obj.getClass());

    if (clazz.equals(Buddy.class)) {
        return clazz.cast(BuddyRealmProxy.copyOrUpdate(realm, (Buddy) obj, update, cache));
    } else {
        throw getMissingProxyClassException(clazz);
    }
}
</code></pre>
